title: Can anyone stop Lewis Hamilton’s British Grand Prix domination?
description:
After a weekend off, Formula 1 returns with a bang as the teams head to the UK for the first of a Silverstone doubleheader. 
ESPN F1’s Nate Saunders and Alexis Nunes wonder if anyone can stop Lewis Hamilton from winning a sixth British Grand Prix in seven years, and react to the news of canceled races all across the Americas. 
Meanwhile, Laurence Edmondson joins from Silverstone to share an almost poetic description of the Covid test that he, the rest of the media and the race crews are all undertaking to keep everyone safe and Alexis explains why it’s so important that Lewis Hamilton continues to champion the fight against racism after F1’s own disappointing showing so far.
itunes:title: Can anyone stop Lewis Hamilton’s British Grand Prix domination?
itunes:author: ESPN, Alexis Nunes, Laurence Edmondson, Nate Saunders
itunes:subtitle: ESPN F1’s Nate Saunders and Alexis Nunes return to get you up to speed before Formula 1 heads to Silverstone for the British Grand Prix.

After a weekend off, Formula 1 returns with a bang as the teams head to the UK for the first of a Silverstone doubleheader. 
ESPN F1’s Nate Saunders and Alexis Nunes wonder if anyone can stop Lewis Hamilton from winning a sixth British Grand Prix in seven years, and react to the news of canceled races all across the Americas. 
Meanwhile, Laurence Edmondson joins from Silverstone to share an almost poetic description of the Covid test that he, the rest of the media and the race crews are all undertaking to keep everyone safe and Alexis explains why it’s so important that Lewis Hamilton continues to champion the fight against racism after F1’s own disappointing showing so far.
